attributes.action: Ban the importation and distribution of all dyed fish.
attributes.background: Dyeing fish is completely unatural and inhumane. Fish that have been injected with these dyes suffer a dramatically shortened life span and are much more susceptible to infection and disease. It is said that in most cases only 50% of fish actually survive the procedure.
attributes.additional_details: Reference - http://www.pets4homes.co.uk/pet-advice/the-phenomenon-of-dyed-fish-and-how-to-avoid-it.html

attributes.action: Abolish the Lords Spiritual - let secular values prevail!
attributes.background:
The Lords Spiritual consists of 26 Bishops who sit in the House of Lords - including the infamous Justin Welby himself. All have a right to vote and they sit on the Government bench. They have too much religious influence over the United Kingdom. We should be secular!

Abolish the Lords Spiritual!

attributes.action: Stop schools using isolation rooms as punishment for students
attributes.background: Stop schools from using Isolation rooms as punishment for students not only disabled ones or sen ones but for all students. Schools are punishing students more than too often with these rooms they are  abusing their powers as teachers and ignoring the fact they are there to teach not punish.

attributes.action: Cut the foreign aid budget, and use the funds to fix potholes on UK roads.
attributes.background: U.K roads have been seriously neglected by UK governments to the point of being dangerous for road users. Foreign aid should be cut to pay for urgently needed repairs. An annual online audit should be produced for public scrutiny, showing total road tax revenue, and how this money is being spent.

attributes.action: Modify the petition system to force Parliament debate of >100,000 signatures
attributes.background:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Remove "considered for"
attributes.additional_details:
The present UK Government and Parliament petition system states that 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be considered for debate in Parliament."

This appears to be deliberately vague about who, and on what criteria, fair consideration will be given.

Rewrite as 

"At 100,000 signatures, this petition will be debated in Parliament."

attributes.action: Bring back the YTS scheme for the many small businesses.
attributes.background: I am a blacksmith (I am 54), i would love to pass on my skills and keep teach a young person the ropes, however as a small business myself, we just break even as i have invested all our profit into new equipment, i looked into having an apprentice and its currently impossible

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke in the uk for everyone born after 2020 Save our kids.
attributes.background:
Cigarette smoking harms nearly every organ of the body, causes many diseases, and reduces the health of smokers in general.1,2
Quitting smoking lowers your risk for smoking-related diseases and can add years to your life.
attributes.additional_details:
Nhs loses tax revenue from lost productivity when people are made ill by smoking. Conditions caused by smoking cost the NHS billions.
The cost of treating smokers in England was estimated at £2.7 billion in 2006. And that was 10 years ago just think how much it costs the NHS now

attributes.action: Make the day we leave the EU a national holiday within the United Kingdom!
attributes.background: I believe the day the announcement is made stating that The United Kingdom has full left the EU we should have that date as a United Kingdom Bank Holiday and should be a day of reflection of how strong we are as a small country! 'National Brexit Day'!

attributes.action: Give the people of the UK a veto (by referendum) of any trade deal
attributes.background:
The withdrawal of the UK from the EU will leave us in a position where unsafe trade deals could be made threatening the sovereignty of the UK over governance and standards of products and services.
The people of the UK need a deciding voice in any deal before it is enacted

attributes.action: Include MPs from all political parties in the negotiations team for Brexit
attributes.background: The negotiated results will be permanent and are too important to be subject to party politics.  Approaches to strategy and policy could be designed to make sure no one party would be able to obstruct the process. It would help to re-unite the UK and lead to a better outcome for all of us.

attributes.action: Repeal the VED legislation Changes coming into force in April 2017
attributes.background: The proposed VED changes coming into force in April 2017 mean it is no longer an incentive to buy a low polluting car.
attributes.additional_details:
The new changes introduce the same basic charge on each subsequent year of ownership after the first year of ownership meaning if someone bought a 1 year old high polluting car they would pay the same tax as a 1 year old low polluting car removing the incentive to buy the economical car.

A much fairer system would be to move all of the band thresholds down so the emissions target for £0 VED is now 80g/km for example. And the 100g/km band now pays £30 a year and so on.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all companies to recycle
attributes.background: Currently companies including large multinational ones such as macdonalds, cineworld and other industrial companies use plenty of material that is recyclable. However I have noticed that most don't offer the option to do so and most of this material ends up in landfill.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies open to the public should provide recycling stations where the discarded items can be separated into recyclable and non-recyclable waste. 
All businesses should manage their waste into these categories to help protect the environment for all life on earth.

attributes.action: give expats the vote in future referendums
attributes.background: I am petitioning to give expats from the UK the vote in any future referendum in the UK.

attributes.action: Impose minimum standards for UK phone network providers to meet.
attributes.background: Having tried several networks over the years I found that non of our providers can supply a minimum standard phone signal across Norfolk, yet we are now being told about 5G most of us bearly get signal for a call or text or 2G. Our phones are for our safety and with no signal we are not safe.

attributes.action: Ban strikes 1 week before and after the top 10 designated 'peak use' times p/a
attributes.background:
Striking should not be targeted at consumers. 

As strikes cite reasons such as 'safety' for their end purposes, there is no legitimate reason to arrange strikes around the busiest / highest consumer use times. 

This petition would stop consumer suffering whilst still protecting workers rights.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence in plentiful supply today, looking at post offices, airports, trains etc.

attributes.action: Make it 'illegal' to setup None Legal Encampment's, with the Police given Powers
attributes.background:
The Police must be given the Powers to Remove people as they Arrive, it should not be for the Councils and Land Owners to Waste money taking Action, also any Mess/Damage must be got from the ones who caused it like breaking in, and Human Waste.
At this time it is Unfair that Council Money is Waste
attributes.additional_details:
Some in the Traveling sector cause issues with Locals, Fly Tip, our council plus the City council have had to pay out good money in Repairs with one area which a school uses closed for eight days cleaning up their mess and repairs to the grass area, another they lifted out posts to a play area, cut chains on gates Only to be moved on to do the same again, No Law in this practice.

Let's make the Laws apply to All.

attributes.action: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1%
attributes.background: Increase Employee National Insurance by 1% to be used exclusively for the NHS & Social Care. With the NHS and Social Care in turmoil both facing unprecedented funding shortages, it is time for the UK workforce to help further fund these services.
attributes.additional_details: Polling has shown that 48% would support a 1% increase in national insurance contributions to go towards the NHS and Social Care.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for office buildings to keep interior lighting on after hours.
attributes.background: Whilst out and about London recently on a Saturday night, I was struck by how many empty office buildings were lit up across the city with nobody at their desks. This is a massive waste of energy and resources and flies in the face of the Government commitment to reducing carbon emissions.

attributes.action: A life sentence to mean life imprisonment.
attributes.background: A life sentence handed out to criminals should mean they spend the rest of their life behind bars with no option for early release
attributes.additional_details: All too often we hear of people being sentenced for horrific crimes and murders and are told they've been given a 'life sentence ' of which they must serve a minimum of 4 years or something ridiculous like that. Life should mean life, to combat the response of "we don't have the money or the space" - in these cases bring back the death penalty for murderers and child abusers who show no remorse and stop imprisoning people for petty offences like 'possession of cannabis'

attributes.action: Abolish Income Tax
attributes.background:
Income tax in the UK was introduced in 1799 as a TEMPORARY measure to fund the Napoleonic wars which ended in 1815. Income tax was abolished in 1816. 
It was later reinstalled in 1842 due to there being a growing deficit.
attributes.additional_details:
In today's society absolutely everything is taxed. For many people in minimum wage jobs this makes day to day survival a struggle. By abolishing income tax this would give them an extra £60-£80 a month which would be put towards improving their quality of life.
Many people could use this money to feed/clothe/shelter their families and as stated EVERYTHING is taxed therefore is there any need for income tax for everyone to prosper?

attributes.action: Make universal credit phone numbers free
attributes.background: Sign this because it is ridiculous to phone up for help with benefits and money and to have a huge phone bill at the end!

attributes.action: Diwali is Hindu festival and for lot of Hindu it is also their New year as well.
attributes.background: If Diwali is made as a National Holiday like Christmas then it will save Hindu people to use their holiday

attributes.action: Open Centres that provide Class A drugs like Heroin for free to prevent crime.
attributes.background: If there were Centers that provided class A drugs for free and a safe place to take them. Users Registered, agreed to treatment. Then Drug dealers would have no business, muggings, robberies and shoplifting would drop dramatically and few young people would start using.
attributes.additional_details: Open centres across the country. While keeping the sale and use of Heroin illegal elsewhere, in the Centres Heroin and other highly addictive class A drugs would be given to addicts that register and seek treatment. Over night drug dealers would be out of business, muggings, robbery’s, burglary’s and shop lifting would decrease dramatically as addicts no longer need to commit crime. Lastly, drug dealers wouldn’t be pushing drugs onto young naïve people in order to profit from their misery.

attributes.action: Consider a Nationalised, funded Mental Health First Response Service.
attributes.background: UK Police Forces and NHS services now spend around 30% of their time responding to Mental Health sufferers who do not receive the best attention or assistance. A MH Service that are the first responders to Suicide risks and Sectioning requests, who can convey MH Patients to the correct facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Working in the Police, it is being increasingly more and more difficult to tackle Crime and deal with Community issues, when every 3 or 4 of 10 incidents we are responding to are for Mental Health patients that require specialised help that we cannot provide. 
This is tying up Emergency resourcing that can be better used elsewhere, and would provide MH patients with the best care and help possible.
Sectioning people and attending Suicide Risks would be better dealt by more a appropriate agency

attributes.action: Stop all ivory trade from the UK and press for bans globally
attributes.background: Ivory collected after 1947 is currently illegal globally, however, Britain still exports legal Ivory to many countries such as Hong Kong, this  contributes greatly to the Ivory trade and can help salesmen conceal their illegal imports from across Africa, drastically harming elephant populations.

attributes.action: Release Sharbat Gula
attributes.background:
The “Afghan Girl” who graced an iconic cover of National Geographic magazine in 1985 has been arrested in Pakistan on charges of being in the country illegally.

I call upon the UK government to ask for an immediate release of Sharbat Gula.

I request everyone to sign and share the petition.
attributes.additional_details: Sharbat Gula was 12 years old when she was photographed by Steve McCurry in a refugee camp in Pakistan, in December 1984. The haunting image of the green-eyed girl became an international symbol of refugees and of political and social unrest in the region. It has been widely reproduced, making her one of the most recognizable non-celebrity faces of the 20th century.

attributes.action: Do not cut NHS unsociable hours pay.
attributes.background:
There is talk about fresh contracts to be implemented for the rest of the NHS staff. Due to the national shortage of healthcare professionals and workers, it would not be feasible to cut pay further. 
A lot of NHS staff rely on unsociable hours pay, to feed their families and so forth.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS needs a revamp and a boost, but not at the expense of front-line staff. It is not ideal to venture down this path and it would be an idea to explore other options, as opposed to cutting people's pay. The NHS also needs to encourage future employees and this is a solution, to a recruitment problem.

attributes.action: Remove UK passports from disorderly passengers who cause disruption on flights
attributes.background: Media report drunk passengers cause problems & alcohol should be banned on flights. Alcohol is not the problem it is disorderly people. Most travellers enjoy a drink & cause no problems. Like football violence,  remove passports if they cause disruption rather than ban alcohol

attributes.action: Allow TV coverage of Saturday 3PM Premier League Matches
attributes.background: In 1964 Burnley chairman Bob Lord was convinced that televising football on a Saturday afternoon would have a detrimental effect on attendances to stadiums. As such, he created a movement to prevent showing these games,  which still stands today.
attributes.additional_details:
I find this notion to be far outdated, especially if you consider these games are shown all over the world apart from where they're being played?! Then consider the rising cost of premium TV services such as Sky and BT Sport yet consumers are not even receiving coverage of half the premier league games. 

I empathise with the desire to keep fans going to the game, I really do. So I'm proposing something similar to the NFL Blackout policy that requires all tickets to be sold 72 hours prior to kickoff or no TV coverage

attributes.action: Make Commonwealth Day a public holiday in the UK.
attributes.background: Commonwealth Day is the second Monday in March. When the UK leaves the EU it will need to be global facing to make Brexit a success. Celebrating Commonwealth Day with a public holiday will help remind the UK public of its friends around the world who share history and cultural values with the UK.

attributes.action: All schools in the U.K. to employ an anti bullying officer/mediator.
attributes.background: I want to try to achieve to get implemented in schools a anti bullying officer/mediator appointed solely for that role in every school... they don't need a teaching degree it would help the children the school and the burden on other teachers.
attributes.additional_details: My child was severy bullied for a few years I could never get to speak to anyone at schools they was always busy my son was suicidal and he got no support. The problem is never tried to be fixed schools hope it will blow over and go away. Teachers aren't fully trained to look out for signals of a bullied child. I believe a person appointed to solely deal with all aspects of bullying within schools will massively reduce bullying statistics!and give teachers the time to teach!

attributes.action: Request a referendum on the £3.9bn refurbishment of the Palace of Westminster
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, request that the UK Government hold a legally binding referendum as to whether the proposed refurbishment of the Palace of Westminster should take place, or whether instead, a new Parliamentary campus be established, allowing for disposal of the old site.
attributes.additional_details:
Give the people of the UK a say over where its parliament sits. 

The Palace of Westminster may occupy a historic site, but it is no longer fit for purpose. 

Build a modern, safe, secure, functional parliamentary campus with chambers, offices and accommodation on site. 

Turn the genuinely historic parts into a museum and sell off the rest of Westminster.

https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/mar/10/parliaments-buildings-risk-catastrophic-failure-without-urgent-repairs#comment-94650543

attributes.action: Introduce Nutrition as a core subject to the National Curriculum
attributes.background: With the ongoing and ever increasing obesity epidemic, young people need to be educated in how to keep their bodies healthy from an early age. By educating them and getting them excited about food and nutrition, I hope that we can help to solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015/16 the National Child Measurement Programme revealed that 19.8% of children in Year 6 were obese and a further 14.3% were overweight. Overweight and obese children are likely to become overweight adults and continue to have an increased risk of developing various physical, emotional and psychological problems. The government needs to act now to help solve this crisis by educating the young people of the UK so they are fully informed of how to keep themselves healthy.

attributes.action: Restore the Hereditary Peers and Appellate Committee to the House of Lords.
attributes.background: The House of Lords is no longer independent of the political parties in the House of Commons, leading to the destruction of the British Parliamentary system. We have lost Liberty and Justice because of this. To correct this we must restore the Hereditary Peers and Appellate Committee in the Lords.
attributes.additional_details: We are now leaving the EU, so we should set about restoring the institutions of the British state, which the EU has undermined with the support the political parties in the House of Commons. The House of Lords should be a House of legacy and law, a check on the power of political parties and the government. The political parties should no longer be able to stack the House to block the will of the British people.

attributes.action: Introduce lack of medical facilities as a valid material planning objection
attributes.background: If evidence is given that the local medical center cannot support  a proposed planning application due to lack of capacity it should be applied as a valid reason as to why a planning application is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Ask Mrs May to decide now, what is going to happen to EU citizens living in UK.
attributes.background: Following a referendum held on 23 June 2016, the UK government intends to invoke Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union by the end of March 2017.This would put the UK on a course to leave the EU by March 2019, but we know very little about the terms and consequences for EU citizens living in UK.
attributes.additional_details: As the time to permanently leave the EU quickly approaches, there is very little info on what the terms are going to be for EU citizens that have been living in the UK for years and entered legally.There have been stories about people living here for 30 years, that now face deportation.  This suppose family separation, or having to go live in a country that is not your home and it is not fair.  We want to know now so we can plan the rest of our lives and not be treated as illegal aliens.

attributes.action: Summon the ambassador of the United states of America to the Foreign office
attributes.background: The treatment of British citizen Juhel Miah by American officials in Reykjavik is unacceptable.  We petition Boris Johnson to summon the ambassador of the USA to the Foreign & commonwealth office to explain the reasons for Mr Miah's refusal of entry to the USA and to offer an official apology.
attributes.additional_details:
It would appear Mr Miah has been the victim of racial profiling and has been given no reason for the denial of his entry to the United States of America. He was not allowed to board a plane in Iceland (bound for the USA) and given no explanation. 

He was travelling to the USA on a school trip as a teacher. 

There has been no response or reason for his treatment given by US officials or the embassy. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Legislate so children can get hot meals free during school holidays
attributes.background: Children on free school meals are not able to access food 170 days a year during school holidays and are going hungry

attributes.action: Force social media to verify its members more throughly to help stop bullying.
attributes.background: Bullying on social media is out of control. It's so easy for someone to say hurtful things, to someone else online that would otherwise been deemed unacceptable in person. These comments are demoralising, hurtful and depressing and are often said without any thoughts of the person they're aimed at.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media needs to offer more protection, help and support to its young, old, vulnerable and genuine members. Banning a troll member is not enough, as they can easily setup another account with a email address and start trolling again. 
Social media needs to verify new members more throughly with debt / credit or electoral register info and ban for life those intent on causing harm to others. Encourage members to take more responsibility for their comments by showing they are a real person.

attributes.action: Allow GCSE Science Students Data Sheets with Ions, Equations & Reactivity Series
attributes.background: The outgoing GCSE Science Specifications include a 'Data Sheet' which consists of very important information for candidates, such as ions. It would be a disadvantage for Reformed GCSE students to not be given said information; especially considering that the new qualifications are more challenging.
attributes.additional_details: In GCSE Chemistry, a sheet with ionic formulae and the Reactivity Series of Some Common Metals is given. In GCSE Physics, a sheet consisting of all mathematical equations is also given. It would be a gross disadvantage for Reformed GCSE students to not be given said information; especially considering that the reformed qualifications are more challenging for individuals taking the examinations in Year 11 and without such sheets, comparison between Legacy and Incumbent qualifications is difficult.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to allow children under the age of 16 to have their body pierced
attributes.background:
I was watching a child cry out of fear and pain in a store which allows children to get there ears pierced. Yes the parents gave consent to it, but the child defiantly didn't know what was going on, watching this really upset me.

I think the law needs to be stricter on piercings in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Despite many piercing salons imposing their own age restrictions for body piercings, there is no legal age restriction for any kind of piercing in England and Wales, unlike in Scotland, where people under 16 are required to have a parent’s permission before having ears and other body parts pierced.

attributes.action: Make GCSEs test students' abilities rather than their memories
attributes.background: The new GCSEs are now based on testing students' abilities to remember things more than to actually answer the question. This makes sense for subjects like history, business studies and biology where the facts are the most important thing. This is not the case for all subjects.
attributes.additional_details: For subjects such as english where students are no longer allowed the texts they are supposed to analyse in the exam at all, it doesn't test students ability to put forward an argument, it tests students' abilities to remember certain things. It is also not practical for physics as learning the 18 formulas in not beneficial and may cause marks to be dropped even though students know what to do but they cannot remember what equation to use.

attributes.action: Retiring UK Soldiers should be fast tracked/prioritised jobs within the police.
attributes.background: Our retiring Soldiers have protected us and our country for hundreds of years with little or no return when they come back to civilian life. They need structure and purpose while they become readjusted to working and living away from the Forces. Intelligence/strength/pride Would win the war on crime
attributes.additional_details: Our police force has become disrespected by the communities they serve. This is in part of lowering standards of our once great police force. The passing fitness test is a joke, once passed They have just 30 minutes a week to spend on fitness so there is no surprise their not up to the high standards they should be! So fast track retiring military into the police, people who are fit, strong, intelligent, think on their feet and who have worked in dangerous environments all their lives.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on abolishing the British Monarchy
attributes.background: Currently, Britain has an unelected Head of State who is unelected and unaccountable. The Queen has rule over all laws that are made in the UK, but doesn't even help make them in the first place. She has consistently shown a lack of any leadership; recently in regards to Donald Trump's state visit.
attributes.additional_details: The Queen has to pass every law made and has the power to veto them. This is not democracy, this is proof that Britain is stuck in the past and desperately needs modernisation. After Britain voted to leave the EU, it is clear that we no longer want people who are unelected ruling over us. A referendum, whatever result is produced, will give the Queen a mandate to leave or lead; it is time to take back democracy.

attributes.action: Get a ban for killing animals for people to eat.
attributes.background: While watching 'Babe' my 6 year old Myla burst into tears while the pigs were being taken to the slaughterhouse and said "this has to stop, mum start a petition to get it stopped". So here we are giving it my best go. Please make a massive change in this world and a little girl happy by signing.

attributes.action: Assaults on emergency personnel the same penalty as assaulting a police officer
attributes.background: Members of the emergency services are being assaulted. This should not be tolerated and should be felt with as severely as Assaulting a Police Officer. This type of abuse must be severely dealt with.
attributes.additional_details: Having known personnel in the emergency service and hearing they are abused nearly everyday.  We have a duty to support them like they do us, when we need them to save our lives.

attributes.action: Make the licencing fee for the BBC optional.
attributes.background: The BBC has an obvious left wing agenda, I don't watch the BBC but because I have the ability to receive it, forces me to pay for it, Surely in this age of technology it can be a "Pay per view" channel.

attributes.action: Make All Public Parking including Hospitals 'FREE' for the Disabled
attributes.background:
It is a disgrace to make these pay, it it hit and miss with some charging and others not, should be the same throughout the country, I know some abuse the system with Blue Badges and should lose them for ever, the charges incurred it a lot of money for Disabled people.
We need a Three Hour system.
attributes.additional_details:
Hospitals make a lot of money already on poorly people, the Disabled should not be one, this is being Anti Disabled and must not be discriminated against.

Let's get things put in order with a system that the Disabled do not have to study each place on if they can or can not.

Disabled Agency sorts some things but money matters to these people on Low income.

attributes.action: Provide funding to migrate all NHS systems from Windows XP for security reasons
attributes.background: Barts NHS trust has just been hit with a ransomware attack, it was running Windows XP. 30 percent of all NHS trusts have been hit by ransomware according to an FOI request by Sentinel One. Moving off Windows XP is efficient, Imperial College NHS Trust found they cut help desk calls by 60 percent.
attributes.additional_details:
Upgrade from Windows XP would be a good start but proper endpoint security is needed to protect against ransomware. Dynamic endpoint protection and DNS level filtering. Anti malware and anti exploit protection is also necessary. 
http://www.computing.co.uk/ctg/news/3002565/barts-nhs-trust-windows-xp-pcs-infected-with-suspected-ransomware 
http://www.dclsearch.com/nhs-trusts-a-magnet-for-ransomware-foi-disclosures-reveal-it-security-news/ 
http://www.theregister.co.uk/2017/01/17/nhs_ransomware/

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for any councillor to fail to pay council tax.
attributes.background: As a lawyer and council tax payer I read of an increasing number of councillors who fail to pay their council tax and this problem cannot be allowed to continue
